Package org.neo4j.internal.schema

Interface IndexConfigCompleter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndexingProvidersService, IndexProviderMap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultIndexProviderMap, FulltextIndexProvider, FusionIndexProvider, GenericNativeIndexProvider, IndexingService, IndexProvider, IndexProvider.Adaptor, IndexProvider.Delegating, LuceneIndexProvider, NativeIndexProvider
    public interface IndexConfigCompleter
    Something that can complete the configuration of index descriptors, by adding any missing configurations, and assigning them capabilities.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IndexDescriptor completeConfiguration​(IndexDescriptor index)
      Since indexes can now have provider-specific settings and configurations, the provider needs to have an opportunity to inspect and validate the index descriptor before an index is created.

    • Method Detail

      • completeConfiguration

        IndexDescriptor completeConfiguration​(IndexDescriptor index)
        Since indexes can now have provider-specific settings and configurations, the provider needs to have an opportunity to inspect and validate the index descriptor before an index is created. The provider also uses this opportunity to assign capabilities to the index. The returned descriptor is a version of the given descriptor which has a fully fleshed out configuration, and is what must be used for creating an index.

        Note that this is an additive and idempotent operation. If an index is already configured, then this method must not overwrite the existing configuration.

        Parameters:
        index - The descriptor of an index that we are about to create, and we wish to its configuration be completed by its chosen index provider.
        Returns:
        An index descriptor with a completed configuration.
